intro: Adenoplusia axillaris, commonly known as the axillary adenoplusia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight aromatic scent. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds.
